page.title: 02Robert Snooks - Highwayman
page.content: {Robert Snooks was the last highwayman {to be hanged.}There is still a stone to mark his grave.He was tried on the 8th March 1802 and he was hanged four days later.He was hanged for a mail robbery.He robbed a postboy,John Stevens,and stole six leather mail bags from him.Snooks shot holes into the bags which held Bank of England fifty and ten pound notes.The postboy, scared out of his wits,ran to inform the postmaster of Berkhamsted. Snooks, who had now fled, was heading for Southwark and then for Hungerford where he was born.When he was caught he was put in Newgate Prison. After some time he was transferred to Hertford Jail. He was charged upon the oaths of John Stevens.He was hanged on 12th March 1802. It is said that if you run round the four trees where he was hanged you will see his ghost.
